result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:23 AM Defendant Jared Andrew Wheaton in court.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for Jared Andrew Wheaton.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
For Substitution of Attorneys signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 09/01/2022.
for Substitution of Attorneys filed by Atty. Matthew H. Huppertz.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol, with the exception that the Defendant may possess alcohol solely for purposes of employment at the Oconomowoc Lake Club.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store with the exception of Oconomowoc Lake Club for his employment.

10:38 AM Defendant Jared Andrew Wheaton in court.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for Jared Andrew Wheaton.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jared Andrew Wheaton. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for Bail/Bond Hearing. 
As both attorneys appear, Court will allow Atty Huppertz to take over the case. Atty Huppertz to file a proposed order after court.
Atty Huppertz addresses WCS report filed. Defense requests no action be taken at this time. State takes no position.
Court will not take action at this time. 
Defense requests bond be amended to allow the Defendant to possess alcohol at his job. 
Court grants the modification. 
Defense requests a new preliminary hearing date. Clerk will reschedule when Defendant goes to sign the new bond.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Atty. Matthew Huppertz.
Bail/bond hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 8/22 received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Jared Andrew Wheaton in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jared Andrew Wheaton. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. 
Atty. Kershek requests bond be modified.  Court clarifies the bond conditions.  Bond remains as previously set.
Request for bail review at earliest convenience

Motion to modify conditions of bail
**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 08-22-2022. "Will hear at Prelim. unless request for sooner date by the defense, then put on any commissioner calendar."
